title: Twistleton Scar Walking Route

images.title: Ray Woodcraft, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The wall runs along the south-eastern edge of Twistleton Scars towards Chapel-le-Dale

images.title: Ray Woodcraft, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Stone man on Twistleton Scars. This is one of several tall cairns on the limestone pavement that runs on the south-eastern slopes of the fell lying between the courses of the Rivers Doe and Twiss. Park Fell that is part of the Ingleborough massif can be seen in the distance.

images.title: Tom Richardson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Limestone walls and a group of cyclists at the site.

images.title: Dave Dunford, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Springcote and Twistleton Scars. From Seato, SD728760, looking northwest across the square.

images.title: John Illingworth / Limestone boulder
images.caption: Limestone boulder. On the limestone pavement above Twistleton Scars, looking towards Ingleborough.

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / White Scar Caves and Ingleborough
images.caption: White Scar Caves and Ingleborough. Seen from the lane which runs below the Crags. The light on this day in November was quite amazingly clear, picking out all the details of the hillside. The summit of Ingleborough is some 4 km distant in SD7474

description: Enjoy wonderful views towards Ingleborough and Whernside on this circular walk in the Yorkshire Dales. It's a moderate walk with great limestone scenery and views of the surrounding hills. You can start and finish the walk from the pretty village of Chapel-le-Dale. To extend your walk, head north east and visit the splendid Ribblehead Viaduct .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: After your exercise treat yourself to well earned refreshments at the Station Inn (Postcode: LA6 3AS). The pub is located next to the Ribblehead Viaduct and is very walker friendly. There's a good menu and you can also book rooms for the night. Just up the road to the west you'll find the Old Hill Inn (LA6 3AR). This pub dates all the way back to 1615 and is another popular spot for walkers exploring the Dales.
